newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico peso closes firmer as dollar demand fades.
newsitem.headline: Mexico peso closes firmer as dollar demand fades.

text.p: The Mexican peso closed firmer against the dollar as early demand for dollars to close the month subsided towards the close, traders said.

"End-of-month demand for dollars put the peso under pressure this morning, but after midday banks began to dump (dollar) positions they hadn't sold," said a peso trader. "That's why the peso firmed up towards the close."
The benchmark 48-hour peso and its 24-hour stablemate closed 0.2 of a centavo and one centavo firmer, respectively, at 7.5290/7.5330 and 7.5160/7.52000 per dollar.
The same-day peso earlier closed 0.4 of centavo weaker at 7.5250/7.5275 per dollar.
Traders said that the foreign exchange market could be quiet on Friday as most dealers seem to have covered end-of-month positions already.

"The market could open with dollars in some demand from those who need to cover positions, but I think that in general there will be little activity, especially after same-day contracts close," another peso trader said.
